scenarioDescription:
The HD 101930 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 101930 is a star with 0.57 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.86 times its radius. It is located 97.94 light years away from the solar system.

HD 101930 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 101930 system


HD 101930 b

HD 101930 b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2005-07, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.30 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 101930 b is 79.500 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 101930 b is 10.600 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 101930 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 101930, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the La Silla Observatory.
name: HD 101930 - System With 1 Exoplanet
